subject: Technology
title: 4G and the Streaming Era
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on 4G and the Streaming Era.

hook.text: You can watch Netflix on a bus today. A decade ago, a two-minute YouTube clip required patience.

buildup.text: 3G networks handled email and basic browsing, but video on the go was nearly impossible.

discovery.text: 4G LTE arrived around 2010, delivering speeds ten times faster than 3G.

twist.text: Suddenly, your phone connection was faster than many home broadband plans.

climax.text: 4G made streaming the default. Netflix, Spotify, and YouTube moved from desktop to pocket.

punchline.text: Faster networks didn't improve phones. They changed entertainment.

quiz.question: What did 4G LTE enable that 3G could not?
options: Smooth video streaming on mobile devices
